channel.title: Leetcode POTDs on The Indian Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Leetcode POTDs on The Indian Engineer

item.title: Problem 729 My Calendar I
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 729 Question You are implementing a program to use as your calendar.

item.title: Problem 874 Walking Robot Simulation
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 874 Question A robot on an infinite XY-plane starts at point (0, 0) facing north.

item.title: Problem 1460 Make Two Arrays Equal by Reversing Subarrays
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1460 Question You are given two integer arrays of equal length target and arr.

item.title: Problem 884 Uncommon Words From Two Sentences
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 884 Question A sentence is a string of single-space separated words where each word consists only of lowercase letters.

item.title: Problem 2419 Longest Subarray With Maximum Bitwise AND
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2419 Question You are given an integer array nums of size n.

item.title: Problem 1310 XOR Queries of a Subarray
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1310 Question You are given an array arr of positive integers.

item.title: Problem 1684 Count the Number of Consistent Strings
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1684 Question You are given a string allowed consisting of distinct characters and an array of strings words.

item.title: Problem 2220 Minimum Bit Flips to Convert Number
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2220 Question A bit flip of a number x is choosing a bit in the binary representation of x and flipping it from either 0 to 1 or 1 to 0.

item.title: Problem 2807 Insert Greatest Common Divisors in Linked List
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2807 Question Given the head of a linked list head, in which each node contains an integer value.

item.title: Problem 2326 Spiral Matrix IV
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2326 Question You are given two integers m and n, which represent the dimensions of a matrix.

item.title: Problem 725 Split Linked List in Parts
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 725 Question Given the head of a singly linked list and an integer k, split the linked list into k consecutive linked list parts.

item.title: Problem 1367 Linked List in Binary Tree
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem Question Given a binary tree root and a linked list with head as the first node.

item.title: Problem 2028 Find Missing Observations
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2028 Question You have observations of n + m 6-sided dice rolls with each face numbered from 1 to 6.

item.title: Problem 1945 Sum of Digits of String After Convert
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1945 Question You are given a string s consisting of lowercase English letters, and an integer k.

item.title: Problem 1894 Find the Student That Will Replace the Chalk
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1894 Question There are n students in a class numbered from 0 to n - 1.

item.title: Problem 2022 Convert 1D Array to 2D Array
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2022 Question You are given a 0-indexed 1-dimensional (1D) integer array original, and two integers, m and n.

item.title: Problem 947 Most Stones Removed With Same Row or Column
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 947 Question On a 2D plane, we place n stones at some integer coordinate points.

item.title: Problem 1905 Count Sub Islands
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1905 Question You are given two m x n binary matrices grid1 and grid2 containing only 0's (representing water) and 1's (representing land).

item.title: Problem 1514 Path With Maximum Probability
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1514 Question You are given an undirected weighted graph of n nodes (0-indexed), represented by an edge list where edges[i] = [a, b] is an undirected edge connecting the nodes a and b with a probability of success of traversing that edge succProb[i].

item.title: Problem 590 N Ary Tree Postorder Traversal
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 590 Question Given the root of an n-ary tree, return the postorder traversal of its nodes' values.

item.title: Problem 264 Ugly Number II
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 264 Question An ugly number is a positive integer whose prime factors are limited to 2, 3, and 5.

item.title: Problem 592 Fraction Addition and Subtraction
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 592 Question Given a string expression representing an expression of fraction addition and subtraction, return the calculation result in string format.

item.title: Problem 476 Number Complement
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 476 Question The complement of an integer is the integer you get when you flip all the 0's to 1's and all the 1's to 0's in its binary representation.

item.title: Problem 650 2 Keys Keyboard
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 650 Question There is only one character 'A' on the screen of a notepad.

item.title: Problem 624 Maximum Distance in Arrays
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 624 Question You are given m arrays, where each array is sorted in ascending order.

item.title: Problem 860 Lemonade Change
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 860 Question At a lemonade stand, each lemonade costs $5.

item.title: Problem 719 Find K Th Smallest Pair Distance
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 719 Question The distance of a pair of integers a and b is defined as the absolute difference between a and b.

item.title: Problem 40 Combination Sum II
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 40 Question Given a collection of candidate numbers (candidates) and a target number (target), find all unique combinations in candidates where the candidate numbers sum to target.

item.title: Problem 703 Kth Largest Element in a Stream
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 703 Question Design a class to find the kth largest element in a stream.

item.title: Problem 3016 Minimum Number of Pushes to Type Word II
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 3016 Question You are given a string word containing lowercase English letters.

item.title: Problem 2053 Kth Distinct String in an Array
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2053 Question A distinct string is a string that is present only once in an array.

item.title: Problem 1508 Range Sum of Sorted Subarray Sums
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1508 Question You are given the array nums consisting of n positive integers.

item.title: Problem 2678 Number of Senior Citizens
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2678 Question You are given a 0-indexed array of strings details.

item.title: Problem 1395 Count Number of Teams
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1395 Question There are n soldiers standing in a line.

item.title: Problem 2976 Minimum Cost to Convert String I
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem Question You are given two 0-indexed strings source and target, both of length n and consisting of lowercase English letters.

item.title: Problem 1334 Find the City With the Smallest Number of Neighbours at a Threshold Distance
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1334 Question There are n cities numbered from 0 to n-1.

item.title: Problem 912 Sort an Array
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 912 Question TLDR: Given an integer array nums, sort it in ascending order.

item.title: Problem 2191 Sort the Jumbled Number
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2191 Question You are given a 0-indexed integer array mapping which represents the mapping rule of a shuffled decimal system.

item.title: Problem 1636 Sort Array by Increasing Frequency
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1636 Question Given an array of integers nums, sort the array in increasing order based on the frequency of the values.

item.title: Problem 2418 Sort the People
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 2418 Question You are given an array of strings names, and an array heights that consists of distinct positive integers.

item.title: Problem 1605 Find Valid Matrix Given Row and Column Sums
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 1605 Question You are given two arrays rowSum and colSum of non-negative integers where rowSum[i] is the sum of the elements in the ith row and colSum[j] is the sum of the elements of the jth column of a 2D matrix.
